oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Executrix' Sale at the Late Residence of D. W. Clark.
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Advertisement for the estate sale of the late D. W. Clark by the executor of his estate, Lucy G. Clark. These items are listed for sale: one mare, one mule, one gold watch, library case, bureau, wash stand, rockaway and harness, center table, office tables, bedroom suites, dining furniture, cooking implements, and "other articles." It offers terms of credit and states any parties having claims against the estate should present them to Lucy G. Clark or her attorney, N. P. Carter, for authentification.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Broadsides
Broadsides; Estate Sales
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Lucy G. Clark
